categories.description: Assign substances to clear hazard tiers (mirroring IARC carcinogen groups, engineering failure tiers).

tiers.criteria: Strong evidence of harm at typical exposure levels.
Moderate evidence; harm under elevated but plausible exposure.
Weak or conditional evidence; requires monitoring.
Evidence of safe use under defined thresholds.

categories.description: Define numeric exposure thresholds requiring automatic label updates.

examples.label_trigger: Relative Risk ≥1.2 for colorectal cancer in ≥3 independent cohorts

categories.description: Document mechanisms of harm like engineering fault trees.

failure_chain: Inhibition of COX enzymes → reduced prostaglandins

categories.description: Every study logged with provenance and replication status.
Automatic generation of public-facing labels once thresholds are crossed.

examples.label: ⚠️ Risk of liver injury and developmental effects. Use ≤3000 mg/day. Higher doses increase risk significantly.
⚠️ Classified Group 1 Carcinogen. Regular consumption increases risk of colorectal cancer.

categories.description: Continuous monitoring, like crash telemetry in race cars.
mechanisms: Adverse event reporting systems (linked automatically to update risk ratios)

principles: Public-facing plain-language labels tied to thresholds
